data.title: Reminder for additional use of TargetDamageWarhead
data.body:
This is just a reminder that `MechRailgun` from TS ([File](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/ts/weapons/energyweapons.yaml#L42)) is a good candidate for `TargetDamageWarhead` once it supports more projectiles!

Source: One of the comments in #12640 to the `energyweapons.yaml`-file

Closes #10615.

data.title: Restores tank traps to the map editor.
data.body:
Tank Traps are missing from the editor because they inherit "^Rock:" from the default.yaml which requires the tileset DESERT.
Tank Traps are a TEMPERAT tileset item.

Fixes #12415

data.title: Idea: New Trait - Airship
data.body:
The problem in ra2 mod is the Kirov Airship, In ra2, Westwood makes a new kind of aircraft, it is the Kirov Airship, the Kirov will throw the bombs to enemy units directly not like the Aircraft in OpenRA, it is not like the AttackBomber either.
In ra2 mod, we use Aircraft to describe the Kirov, but it is not enough, so we need a new trait to describe the Kirov 
Yes, there is no Airship in original OpenRA, but i think we need to give support to the people who want to create something like Kirov

Of course, we can give more options to make people implemt their own style Airship, not only Kirov, it can be Zeppelin

data.title: Make all Create() functions in YyyInfo overridable
Fix and improve AmbientSound trait
data.body:
This fixes the following:
* Sound position is wrong for looped playback.
* Sound doesn't follow the actor when they move.
* Sound doesn't stop when the actor is removed from the world.
* Sound waits for an `Info.Interval` before playing for the first time.
* Code style.

It also adds support for random delays and intervals.

For a testcase, add the following to the ra mig or yak:
```yaml
AmbientSound:
	RequiresCondition: airborne
	SoundFile: dogw3px.aud
	Delay: 100
	Interval: 10, 50
```

Planes should randomly woof while airborne.

data.body:
Fixes #12668.

All other multi-queue logic already is in Common, so I agree that this should be moved there, too.

data.title: Don't require a manual 'make dependencies' by default
ProductionTabsLogic should be moved to Mods.Common
data.body:
ProductionTabsLogic is still in Mods.Cnc while ProductionTabsWidget had been moved to Mods.Common already.

I'm trying to make ra2 mod to have multi-production queues and find out that the underlying UI logic still sits in specific mod, so here comes this issue...

data.title: TS DamagedByTerrain and ^DamagedByVeins: Don't damage actors in tunnels
data.body: Fixes the first item in #12662

data.title: D2K - Upgrades require Construction Yard
data.body: They shouldn't. It actually is easy to fix by moving upgrade production to `Player:` actor. But there is a small problem with it. If i do that After deploying the MCV at start, Upgrade Menu is shown rather than Structure. This is because `ProvidesPrerequisite:` trait takes effect before the `Production:` trait. `Production`, afaik, waits for the buildup to finish before taking effect, while `ProvidesPrerequisite:` doesn't.

data.title: D2K - Add Ordos Mission 1a
data.body: Lua is mostly copy-paste from Atr1a. Map is imported via utility commands, i just did some editing.

data.title: FlatPak package and repository
data.body:
I propose using http://flatpak.org/ to create a centralized package (and update repository) for Linux. This has the benefit of focusing our limited packaging resources on package specification instead of multiple incompatible ones for Ubuntu/Debian and openSUSE/Fedora/CentOS as well as the new ones that are constantly invented.

Flatpak seems to have commercial backing from RedHat and is a vendor neutral Freedesktop project. It is used by the @Mono project which can serve as a template http://apebox.org/wordpress/linux/1184 With Flatpak 0.8 there is now a stable foundation https://blogs.gnome.org/alexl/2016/12/22/a-stable-base-for-flatpak-0-8/ we can build upon.

It has been successfully integrated https://news.opensuse.org/2017/01/26/new-package-in-tumbleweed-enhances-rolling-updates/ in @openSUSE and the @Solus-Project is also planning to support it soon. https://solus-project.com/2017/01/18/adopting-flatpak-to-reassemble-third-party-applications/

data.title: General tunnel issues
data.body:
- [x] Actors in tunnels (ground-level, underground, in-air) should not be damaged by `DamagedByTerrain` #12666
- [ ] We should probably not show the healthbars of damaged non-friendly actors while underground or in ground-level tunnels
- [x] Actors should be (if chosen by the rules author) forced out of tunnels when idle

data.title: Unit slow crush trait.
data.body:
This has been around for fast moving units and has made mention. Is it possible to create a slow crush trait?

Units moving to crush infantry are slowed by half speed with the trait which gives infantry a chance to move out from the way. (APCs, Phase Transports are a few examples).

Having this as a trait would allow heavy tanks and the likes to remain at normal speed for their crushes.

Reason is units that move faster have a higher chance to crush infantry despite the dodge chance because the unit is on the move.

- [x] Move Mods.Cnc.dll to `mods/common` #12763

As discussed on IRC, #12554 and #12617. This should be a relatively easy task and happen before the next release.

D2k should stay separate.

data.title: Support skipping stacked condition levels.
data.body:
Testcase is to replace the RA `^IronCurtainable` default and use the iron curtain multiple times on an actor.  The second level will lighten the actor, and the fourth level will darken it.

```yaml
^IronCurtainable:
	UpgradeOverlay@IRONCURTAIN:
		RequiresCondition: invulnerability && !invulnerability2
	UpgradeOverlay@IRONCURTAIN2:
		Palette: highlight
		RequiresCondition: invulnerability2 && !invulnerability4
	UpgradeOverlay@IRONCURTAIN4:
		Palette: shadow
		RequiresCondition: invulnerability4
	DamageMultiplier@IRONCURTAIN:
		RequiresCondition: invulnerability
		Modifier: 0
	TimedConditionBar:
		Condition: invulnerability
	ExternalConditions@INVULNERABILITY:
		Conditions: invulnerability
	StackedCondition@INVULNERABILITY:
		Condition: invulnerability
		StackedConditions: invulnerability2, , invulnerability4
```

data.title: UpgradeOverlay trait needs to be renamed
data.body: I suggest `WithColoredOverlay`.

data.title: Idea openRA to windows universal app
data.body: It's great to have openRA as an application in the windows store so you can play both pc, mobile and xbox one

data.title: Idea - Horizontal Launch angle for missile and bullet.
data.body:
A small idea that could work well in fancy tanks or maybe even ships, missiles could be fired from an angle away from the front of a unit to create more diversity, would only be useful for modders. 

an example can be seen here in the first 5 seconds, see the yellow ship. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PGxgwv61RF4 

The same effect in bullet could be used to make weapons damage units in a cone in front of them, or other things.
